Title: 🖼 🇬🇷 According to recent government research, Greece loses aro...
Description: 🇬🇷 According to recent government research, Greece loses around half its drinking water from leaky pipes and theft, which is nearly twice the EU average of 23%. Most maps of its underground pipeline network are either not digitised or do not exist, experts and officials said. Even though Athens has spent more than 1.5 billion euros on drinking water infrastructure since 2019, it is still not enough to cover local demands, especially in summer seasons.📝 Reuters🗺 @PoliticsGR

Title: 🔁🖼 — 🇱🇧 🇵🇸 ☦️ A message by Archbishop Atallah Hannah, Archb...
Description: Forwarded From Middle East Spectator – MES— 🇱🇧 🇵🇸 ☦️ A message by Archbishop Atallah Hannah, Archbishop of Sebastia, from the Greek Orthodox Patriarchate of Jerusalem, on the funeral of Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah:'Dear friends, in just a few days, Lebanon will witness a great and exceptional event: the funeral of His Eminence, Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah, and the martyrs who stood with him. We, from Jerusalem, stand in reverence and honor for the sacrifices made by Sayyed Hassan and his companions, those who stood with Palestine, defended it, and paid a heavy price for it. We are loyal to these sacrifices. All Palestinians are loyal to the sacrifices of Sayyed Hassan and his comrades.While we send our condolences from the heart of our holy city, we want to express that we will never forget those who stood with Palestine and defended it during the most difficult times and under the harshest conditions. Today, the Palestinian cause is being conspired against. Our enemies seek to displace our people and erase our cause. But the Palestinians will never raise the flag of surrender. We hold firmly to our rights, our principles, and our constants. The word 'surrender' has no place in our Palestinian dictionary.Dear friends, we are all one family, one nation, facing the colonial projects that do not only target Palestine but the entire nation. Our message has always been, and will continue to be, that Palestine is the compass. Whoever’s compass is Palestine is in the right place, and whoever’s compass points elsewhere is in the wrong place. We urge them to correct their course and set their compass in the right direction.Our dear friends, our message today is that we, as a community, must remain united, Christians and Muslims, across all sects and denominations. They want us to be fragmented, divided. They want us to speak the language of sectarianism. They want us divided so they can implement their projects, following the well-known adage 'divide and conquer.' They want to divide us so they can push forward their colonial projects that target Palestine and the entire nation.We will remain Christians and Muslims in this region, one nation, with our compass pointing to Jerusalem, and our cause being Palestine. We must not allow anyone, or any entity, to push projects aimed at further division and fragmentation. We are one family, and that is how we have been, and how we will always remain.'@Middle_East_Spectator

Title: 🇸🇰 Slovak coalition parties have agreed to give up one ministry...
Description: 🇸🇰 Slovak coalition parties have agreed to give up one ministry each to Robert Fico’s SMER, bringing his party’s total number of ministries to nine. Social democratic HLAS maintains six ministries and nationalist SNS two.This gives Fico’s party additional strength and to attract government dissidents from coalition parties. Three SNS MPs defected from their factions after demanding seats in government posts and two HLAS MPs were expelled from the party, which culminated in the loss of seat majority for the government.📝 Euronews🗺 @PoliticsGR

Title: 🖼 🇬🇷 The next pictures are from a hotel being constructed in S...
Description: 🇬🇷 The next pictures are from a hotel being constructed in Sarakiniko, Milos, a well-known beach across the world. The project was licensed a few months ago and construction took off a few weeks ago. In contrast to the reactions in Thassos, Milos’ residents were more concerned about the construction and they staged multiple protests against the ongoing works. The island’s mayor, Manolis Mikelis, acknowledged the limitations of local authorities in stopping the project as the municipal council is unable to even express its opinion on such projects, which are usually approved by the central authorities.📝 Proto Thema🗺 @PoliticsGR

Title: 🖼 🇬🇷 Disgusting images from the beach of Potos in the island o...
Description: 🇬🇷 Disgusting images from the beach of Potos in the island of Thassos, which has been divided for the construction of a canal connecting the sea to the nearby Alexandra Beach Hotel.The project was licensed in 2016/17 and construction began a few months ago. When residents noticed it, they applied to the authorities, which replied that they knew nothing about the project and said they were unable to cancel the license. Despite the damages, most residents are apathetic about the developments in their island.📝 Kathimerini🗺 @PoliticsGR

Description: 🇺🇸🇮🇱🇵🇸 In an extraordinary and provocative move, US President Donald Trump has proposed that Washington assume control of the Gaza Strip and turn it into the -Riviera of the Middle East- after its residents leave. Today’s article contains a brief capture of events since the ceasefire, an explanation of Trump’s policy on the Middle East issue, and we will finally discuss whether recent moves will prevent the implementation of a two-state solution.PoliticsGRTrump's surprise Gaza takeover proposal; an international anomalyIs the two-state solution still feasible?

Title: ↩️🖼 💬 @PoliticsGR Commentary: 🇺🇸🇦🇷 So we got a new strategy...
Description: PoliticsGR - Geopolitics, Intel, News, Statistics: 💬 @PoliticsGR Commentary:🇺🇸🇦🇷 So we got a new strategy to enrich politicians:🔸 Create a meme coin using a simplistic smart contract.🔸 Publish tokenomics with very vague distribution quota, most of the coin reserves go to -community development- or -public growth- and the rest are used for liquidity. However, a quick research on the contract’s address shows most of the tokens are held by one or a network of connected addresses.🔸 Promote it across social media saying it will promote public interest (citizen freedom, domestic growth etc).🔸 Shills fall for the scam, spend thousands on the coin in the hope of becoming rich overnight.🔸 Insiders pull out their money, the coin gets rug pulled. Everyone else loses his money and complains on Twitter.What started as ordinary corruption has expanded to new means of finance, with the results being the same; politicians getting rich off ordinary people. And it’s ludicrous how mostly conservatives fall for it since they are the same to oppose CBDCs.

Title: 🖼 🇦🇷 A day ago, Argentina's president Javier Milei launched $L...
Description: 🇦🇷 A day ago, Argentina's president Javier Milei launched $LIBRA, a digital token to support small businesses and stimulate the economy as part of the broader Viva La Libertad strategy. The $LIBRA token is linked to KIP Protocol, a Web3 framework for AI, with partnerships involving national governance. According to its tokenomics, at least 50% of the reserves would go to stimulate growth. However, research on Bubblemaps revealed that 82% of the supply was held at a few connected wallets, raising suspicions about price manipulation.Eventually, the coin’s launch turned into a disaster after insiders cashed out over $107 million, wiping out nearly 94% of the token’s value within hours.📝 CoinTelegraph, CryptoBriefing🗺 @PoliticsGR

Title: 🇺🇸 The Senate on Thursday confirmed John Ratcliffe as CIA direc...
Description: 🇺🇸 The Senate on Thursday confirmed John Ratcliffe as CIA director, President Donald Trump’s nominee to lead America’s premier spy agency and his second nominee to win Senate approval.Ratcliffe was director of national intelligence during Trump’s first term and is the first person to have held that position and the top post at the CIA. The Texas Republican is a former federal prosecutor who emerged as a fierce Trump defender while serving as a congressman during Trump’s first impeachment.At his Senate hearing last week, Ratcliffe said the CIA must do better when it comes to using technology such as artificial intelligence to confront adversaries including Russia and China. He said the United States needed to improve its intelligence capabilities while also ensuring the protection of Americans’ civil rights.-We’re not where we’re supposed to be,- Ratcliffe told members of the Senate Intelligence Committee.📝 AP🗺 @PoliticsGR

Title: ↩️ 💬 @PoliticsGR Commentary: 🇺🇦🇷🇺 I personally don’t publish...
Description: PoliticsGR - Geopolitics, Intel, News, Statistics: 🇺🇦🇷🇺 Ukraine launched a large-scale drone attack on Ryazan, Russia! The oil refinery in the city has been hit at least by 10 drones and is in flames. The Novo-Ryazan Thermal Power Station was also successfully hit by Ukrainian drones. Ukrainian channels… 💬 @PoliticsGR Commentary:🇺🇦🇷🇺 I personally don’t publish evolutions from the Russo-Ukrainian war anymore for a reason; the situation on the front is clearly a stalemate (clashes in Donetsk villages, siege of Pokrovsk, Russians are 4.5 kilometres from Dnipropetrovsk oblast and still don’t go in, Ukrainians conduct a counteroffensive in Kursk in an attempt to maintain their positions and fail). However, a topic I haven’t seen mentioned a lot in Telegram channels is drone warfare, and it’s where Ukrainians have a significant competitive edge, enabling them to deal constant damage to Russian energy and military facilities.To conduct a thorough analysis, we need to compare the aerial weapons employed in long-range attacks. Moscow predominantly relies on the Shahed 136 drone (also referred to as Geran-2), a -kamikaze drone- that is utilised alongside ballistic and cruise missiles. Locally-produced variants usually range from below $20,000 to $50,000, while drones exported from Iran are estimated at about $190,000 after a negotiated settlement. Even though Geran-2 remains a lethal weapon and is used frequently, it alone is not sufficient to conduct a sophisticated strike. Coupled with the high cost of missiles, with Kinzhals ranging up to $13 million, the Kremlin needs to cover significant expenses to plan a attack. The only field in which Russia was able to develop cost-effective drones was in reconnaissance operations, which are capable of detecting enemy defences in order to destroy them.On the other hand, Ukraine possesses a diversified drone stack, employing it in both direct combat and long-range attacks. Obviously the main milestone is the minimisation of costs in FPV drones, which accelerated production and usage in the battlefield. However, it has also improved its long-range arsenal, with notable examples being UJ-22, UJ-26 and An-196 Lyutyy and the second drone costing only about $100,000 per piece. Nevertheless, latest power struggles and corruption in government drone procurements could pose a threat to the buildup.In modern wars, military supremacy alone cannot win wars; the battlefield requires a consistent flow of cutting-edge technology, which should gradually become cheaper by reducing marginal costs. I believe we could draw parallels to the strategies used by non-state actors, such as Ansarullah and HTS taking into account they both developed cheaper drone models to offset enemies relying on more expensive technology.

Title: 🔁🖼 ⚡️🇸🇾🇷🇺 Cancellation of Investment Contract with Russia i...
Description: Forwarded From ShamS⚡️🇸🇾🇷🇺 Cancellation of Investment Contract with Russia in Tartus Unrelated to Military Bases Syria has annulled its investment contract with Russia in Tartus due to the inability of the Russian company to fulfill its obligations, according to Alexei Chepa, the First Deputy Chairman of the Russian State Duma’s International Affairs Committee.Chepa attributed the collapse of the agreement to Moscow’s assumption of responsibility for civilian maintenance at the port. However, with a sharp reduction in Moscow’s presence, fulfilling these obligations has become increasingly difficult. He emphasized that this matter should not be linked to Russia’s military bases, as the two are distinctly separate issues.❗️Cancellation of investment contract will have no negative impact Russian-Syrian relations. According to Asharq Al-Awsat, a high-level Russian delegation is likely to visit Damascus in the near future. Discussions regarding the timing and arrangements for this visit are currently underway.Telegram | X

President Trump said he will appeal the decision.📝 Reuters🗺 @PoliticsGR
